Rosie should have known better than to trust Marnie with Rosie‚Äôs investments.

After all, Marnie doesn‚Äôt have any background or credentials or expertise in financial planning.

There was no reason to think Marnie would be able to manage Rosie‚Äôs assets, but Rosie wanted to give her a chance.

Oh, well. Bad move on Rosie‚Äôs part.

Even someone of Rosie‚Äôs intellectual stature screws up sometimes.

Sure, she may understand quantum physics better than any other cat on the planet, but that doesn‚Äôt mean she understands compound interest.

Sigh‚Ä¶

Now Rosie has to think of a way of to recoup all those losses. Hmm‚Ä¶ What could she invent?
